name: enlistment
content:
enlistment noun
(JOINING ARMY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the action of accepting someone into the armed forces or of joining the armed forces: the enlistment of thousands of men into the army He said he’d like to see the armed forces offer short-term enlistments for college students.
More examplesFewer examplesOne possibility would be to increase the maximum age for enlistment to 40.She is looking ahead to Air Force enlistment next spring. Recruiters said the biggest challenge to enlistment was passing a basic aptitude test on English and maths skills.

enlistment noun
(GETTING HELP)
[ U ] the action of getting help from someone or something: The enlistment of chefs was part of her campaign against childhood obesity.
More examplesFewer examplesMuseum officials are looking to the enlistment of corporate partners to make the Smithsonian brand more profitable.the enlistment of an increasing number of economists to the design processThe show traces Tom's many pranks, including his enlistment of friends to whitewash Aunt Polly's fence. One factor in his comeback was the enlistment of assistance from a noted sports psychologist.
